drinks.name: Jungle Bird
drinks.description: Theo Lieberman of Lantern’s Keep says, “It tastes like you’re eating pancakes covered in maple syrup and drinking a cup of coffee.”

drinks.name: Queen Palm
drinks.description: “I don’t remember creating this drink,” says Thomas Waugh, who reports finding this recipe in his pocket one morning, after a few too many post-shift Zombies at Death & Company.

drinks.name: Grass Kilt
drinks.description: Brian Miller was inspired to make this drink by a Puerto Rican friend whose family would cut off the top of a coconut and pour scotch into it.

drinks.name: Tia Mia
drinks.description: During her time at Lani Kai, Ivy Mix wanted to make a classic tiki drink using mezcal — a decidedly non-tiki spirit. The result is a wonderful, smoky twist on a Mai Tai.
ingredients: Tiki Adam’s Macademia Nut Orgeat Syrup

drinks.name: Rita Hayworth
drinks.description: This twist on a classic margarita is named after Rita Hayworth (the woman who inspired the original margarita cocktail), whose real name was Margarita Cansino.
ingredients: Pineapple- and Sage-Infused Herradura Silver Tequila
